item.title: List of Polychlorinated Biphenyl (PCB) Disposal Facilities and Approvals by Technology Type and EPA Region
item.description:
The following table shows disposal approvals issued under the Toxic Substances Control Act (TSCA) to accept and/or dispose of PCB waste. These facilities are either permitted by EPA to dispose of PCB waste or may handle or dispose of certain types of PCB waste outside of a permit in accordance with the regulations outlined in Title 40 of the Code of Federal Regulations in part 761. The table can be searched by key word or sorted by column heading. For approvals that are multi regional, you can access a copy of the disposal approval in PDF format by clicking the name of the facility. You can also view a List of PCB Commercial Storage Facilities.

Company Address City State Zip Code Phone Number Technology Type Region

item.dc:creator: carcari

item.title: Solomon Receiving Bay Water Removal Procedures
item.description:
This procedure will be followed strictly as written to ensure compliance with TSCA and City of Prairie du Chien regulations. The purpose of this procedure is to ensure water removed from the receiving bay in Prairie du Chien is free from untested oil and other contaminates prior to being released to the storm water removal system.

  • Solomon Receiving Bay Water Removal Procedures (PDF)(2 pp, 37 K)
item.dc:creator: esundin

item.title: Solomon Operational Plan
item.description:
This procedure defines the process for material handling of electrical equipment coming into or routed through the Prairie du Chien Facility. This material is defined by equipment type, PCB classification and intent of use (i.e. repair, recondition, recycle or disposal).

  • Solomon Operational Plan (PDF)(4 pp, 51 K)
item.dc:creator: esundin

item.title: Solomon Untested and Quality Control Procedure
item.description:
Solomon Corporation has several quality control procedures in place to ensure compliance above and beyond what is required from TSCA regulations. This document will define the difference between untested and quality control units, and define how to handle each type of sample.

  • Solomon Untested and Quality Control Procedure (PDF)(7 pp, 45 K)
item.dc:creator: esundin

item.title: Solomon Corporation Safety Manual
item.description:
The Solomon Corporation Safety Manual outlines the responsibility and accountability for the administration of the HSE Program.

  • Solomon Corporation Safety Manual (PDF)(560 pp, 4 MB)
item.dc:creator: esundin

item.title: EPA Letter to Solomon, Notice of Deficiency on April 2016 Application for PCB Commercial Storage
item.description:
This document is a notice of deficiency from EPA to Solomon concerning their April 2016 application for a permit to store PCBs and PCB containing items for disposal. This notice was given on April 27, 2016.

  • EPA Letter to Solomon, Notice of Deficiency on April 2016 Application for PCB Commercial Storage (PDF)(4 pp, 327 K)
item.dc:creator: esundin

item.title: Solomon May 2016 Cover Letter for Revised Application
item.description:
This is the cover letter from Solomon Corporation to USEPA Region 5, which states there is a revised copy of the PCB Storage Permit Application enclosed.

  • Solomon May 2016 Cover Letter for Revised Application (PDF)(1 pg, 244 K)
item.dc:creator: esundin

item.title: Solomon May 2016 Commercial Storage Permit Application
item.description:
This is Solomon's application for a permit to store PCBs and PCB containing items for disposal. The permit would allow Solomon Corporation to receive equipment and waste that is either known or assumed PCB, or equipment whose PCB content is unknown at receipt. Solomon Corporation would test and store equipment for disposal at an authorized disposal facility as detailed in the permit application.

  • Solomon May 2016 Application for Permit to Store PCBs and PCB Containing Items for Disposal (PDF)(51 pp, 1 MB)
item.dc:creator: esundin
